content: Hsin-Hao SuSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationHsin-Hao SuI am an assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science at Boston College.Â I obtained my Ph.D. at University of Michigan (2010-2015), advised by Seth Pettie. Then, I was a postdoctoral associate in Nancy Lynch's group at MIT from 2015 to 2017.Professional Services:PC Member of: ISAAC 2025, ESA 2022, DISC 2021, OPODIS 2020, ICDCS 2020, PODC 2019, ICDCS 2018, ICALP 2017.Workshop Chair of PODC 2021Student Travel Awards Organizer of PODC 2018Research Interests:Distributed computing through the lens of theoretical computer scienceParallelism, locality, and communicationCombinatorial optimization and symmetry breaking problemsGossip-based algorithms and bio-inspired AlgorithmsGoogle SitesReport abusePage detailsPage updated Google SitesReport abuse
